title: Introduction to the Principles of Business

questionList.qu: What is the management function of using/developing people within a business?
questionList.solution: Human resource management or HRM.

questionList.qu: What is not a role of HRM?
questionList.solution: Production process is part of operations management.

questionList.qu: How is labour turnover rate calculated? (omitting the *100 at the end for %)
questionList.a1: number of staff leaving / total number of staff
questionList.a2: number of staff in work / total number of staff
questionList.a3: total number of staff - number of staff leaving / total number of staff
questionList.a4: number of staff in work + total number of staff / number of staff leaving
questionList.solution: Labour turnover rate = number of staff leaving / total number of staff `*` 100.

questionList.qu: What does CLAMPS stand for?
questionList.a1: Challenge, location, advancement, money, pride, security
questionList.a2: Challenge, level, advancement, money, price, security
questionList.a3: Challenge, location, autonomy, money, price, security
questionList.a4: Challenge, location, autonomy, merit, pride, security
questionList.solution: CRAMPS - acronym for main reasons for leaving jobs.

questionList.qu: What is not an effect of an ageing population accompanied by a decreased birth rate?
questionList.solution: Technological advancement doesn't have to do with the ageing population.

questionList.qu: How is the net migration rate calculated?
questionList.solution: Net migration rate = immigrants - emmigrants (people leaving).

questionList.qu: Which doesn't experience change due to new communcation technologies?
questionList.solution: Retirement age is caused by demographic changes.

questionList.qu: What does the TRAPS acronym stand for?
questionList.solution: TRAPS is the acronym for designing effective job advertisements.

questionList.qu: What is not part of the application process?
questionList.solution: Interviews are part of the selection process.

questionList.qu: What is not one of the main types of testing?
questionList.solution: Types of testing: psychometric, aptitude, intelligence, trade.

questionList.qu: What is the most common method of selection?
questionList.solution: Interviews are the most common type.

questionList.qu: What is an advantage of internal recruitment
questionList.solution: Quicker adaptation to the business if it's coming from someone already working there.

questionList.qu: What is a disadvantage of external recruitment?
questionList.solution: External recruitment tends to be more expensive.

questionList.qu: What is not an objective of training?
questionList.solution: Financial costs is the major drawback of training.

questionList.qu: What is induction training?
questionList.a1: Partnership between experienced staff and new employee to develop skills
questionList.a2: Helping new employees at the organization settle in quickly
questionList.a4: Developing mental skills to improve work performance
questionList.solution: Induction training allows workers to settle in quickly.

questionList.qu: What is not a limitation of cognitive training?
questionList.a1: Doesn't cater for individual trainee needs
questionList.solution: Cognitive training helps develop mental skills to improve work performance.

questionList.qu: What is not a type of appraisal?
questionList.solution: 3 types of appraisals (formal assessments).

questionList.qu: What is not a type of behavioral training?
questionList.solution: Memory practice is part of cognitive training.

questionList.qu: What is an advantage of mentoring?
questionList.solution: Mentoring hels achieve synergy (1+1 > 2).

questionList.qu: What is 360-degree feedback?
questionList.a1: Getting feedback from multiple companies about the employee
questionList.a2: Getting feedback from peers and subordinates about the employee
questionList.a3: Getting feedback from customers that interacted with the employee
questionList.a4: Getting feedback from the mentor of the employee
questionList.solution: 360-degree feedback: collects appraisal evidence from peers/subordinates/line managers that have direct contact with the employee.
